page.title: 21ICI Runcorn (Now Ineos Runcorn)
page.content:
As the author of the article - Parents Workplace in 1986, I was pleased to be able take part in the Project 25 Years later with my 15 Year Old Son.

The main offices at Runcorn Heath was launched as an independent business and technical park in 2000 by a group of then-ICI managers and a successful local external businessman, following the announcement by the chemicals giant that it was to close its operation on the 50-acre site.

The chemical works was acquired by INEOS in 2001 and became INEOS Chlor who are still a major Runcorn employer with approximately 2500 employees remaining.

The Power station that is visible to right of Picture 1 in 1986 was closed in 2008 and is to be replaced with an energy from waste, combined heat and power plant that will provide 20% of the site's energy needs.

Paul Jackson-Spruce
